task.title: Install using the all platforms installer

taskbody.context: To install using the all platforms installer:The file is used as a common source for platform specific versions that have the right file names in step 5. Once DITA has local variables, this file and its variants should be consolidated and local variables should be used to insert the right platform-specific file names.

step.cmd: Download the all platforms installation package (oxygen.tar.gz oxygenAuthor.tar.gzoxygenDeveloper.tar.gzsyncroSVNClient.tar.gz) to a folder of your choice.
Extract the archive in that folder.
step.stepresult: is now installed in a new sub-folder called oxygenoxygenAuthoroxygenDevelopersyncroSVNClient.

step.cmd: You may remove the downloaded archive or keep it where you usually keep your applications installation kits.

You may move the folder where you installed to your applications folder and maybe also rename it to contain the product version information, for example you can rename it as oxygenoxygenAuthoroxygenDevelopersyncroSVNClient.

Presumably the way you start Oxygen and the way you enter your license is different when it is installed on a server. How is it done in these cases?Start by running oxygen.XXXoxygenAuthor.XXXoxygenDeveloper.XXXsyncroSVNClient.XXX, which is located in the install folder.
To license your copy of go to Help Register... and enter your license information.
